info.title: Notte API
info.description: Notte API is a REST API that allows you to interact with Notte. It is used to create cloud browser sessions, scrape webpages, and run web ai agents to act on your behalf on the internet.

get.description:
List all sessions for the authenticated user.

By default, returns the last 10 active sessions.
Sessions are ordered by creation date (newest first).
No pagination is currently supported.

parameters.name: page

schema.description: Page number
schema.title: Page

parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of items per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of items per page

parameters.name: only_active

schema.description: Whether to only return active sessions
schema.title: Only Active

parameters.description: Whether to only return active sessions

parameters.name: only_current_token

schema.description: Whether to only return sessions for the current token (apikey)
schema.title: Only Current Token

parameters.description: Whether to only return sessions for the current token (apikey)

post.description:
Start a new browser session.
Configure timeout, max steps, proxies, and browser type in the request.

Important information:
* The maximum session duration is set to 30 minutes and cannot be changed.
* However, the `session_timeout` parameter in the request allows you to specify a timeout for the session steps (defaults to 3 minutes). This timeout is triggered on session inactivity, i.e when no operation (i.e agents, scrape, observe, steps, etc.) is performed for a while.
* You can turn on proxies in the request to increase the chances of bypassing bot detection mechanisms (for an additional cost).
* Different browser types are available with different security measures in place to prevent detection. If you are flagged as a bot try to switch to chrome or firefox instead of chromium

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/sessions/start" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"headless": true,
"solve_captchas": false,
"timeout_minutes": 3,
"proxies": false,
"browser_type": "chromium",
"user_agent": null,
"chrome_args": null,
"viewport_width": null,
"viewport_height": null,
"cdp_url": null,
"use_file_storage": false,
"screenshot_type": "last_action"
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

get.description:
Get the current status of a session, including its metadata and state.

You can retrieve the status of a session at any time whether it is active or not.

Session states also contain all steps (i.e actions and observations) performed during the session.
You can use this information to reconstruct the session execution and diagnose potential issues.

delete.description:
Manually close an active session.
The session will be marked as closed and resources will be released.

Only sessions that are active can be stopped (othertherise a 404 error is returned).

Note: billing is based on session durations (i.e session start and stop times).

post.description:
Upload cookies to a session. These cookies will be available throughout the session duration.

Note: Cookies are not saved or processed by Notte. Ensure cookies are valid for your target domain and not expired.
For local cookie generation, use a headful browser session and save the cookies using the provided script.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/sessions/start" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"headless": true,
"solve_captchas": false,
"timeout_minutes": 3,
"proxies": false,
"browser_type": "chromium",
"user_agent": null,
"chrome_args": null,
"viewport_width": null,
"viewport_height": null,
"cdp_url": null,
"use_file_storage": false,
"screenshot_type": "last_action"
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

get.description: Get cookies that are in the currently running session

Get debug information for a session including WebSocket endpoints for CDP, recording, and logs.

The debug URL can be opened in a browser for live session monitoring (only availble when session is active)
Retrieve the WebP format visual replay of a session's execution.
Retrieve the WebP format visual replay of a session's execution.

post.description:
Detect available actions on a webpage within the session's environment.

Returns a snapshot of the current state including available actions, metadata, and optional screenshot.

The optional `url` parameter is used to navigate to a specific URL before observing the page.
If not provided, the session will remain on the current page.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/sessions/$session_id/page/observe" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"min_nb_actions": null,
"max_nb_actions": 100,
"url": null,
"instructions": null,
"perception_type": null
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

post.description:
Execute an action in the browser session and observe the resulting state.

The step endpoints should only be used after a previous observe (or another step) call.
Observations give you a snapshot of the current state, including available actions.
Stepping allows you to execute an action and observe the resulting state.

Example of a step request:
```json
{
    "type": "fill",
    "value": "lucas@notte.cc",
    "selector": "email-input",
}
```

Returns a new observation of the new state after executing the specified action.

Extract content from a webpage within the session's environment.

Supports various extraction modes including link scraping and main content extraction.
Can optionally use LLM for more sophisticated content extraction.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/sessions/$session_id/page/scrape" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"scrape_links": true,
"scrape_images": false,
"ignored_tags": null,
"only_main_content": true,
"only_images": false,
"response_format": null,
"instructions": null,
"use_link_placeholders": false
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

post.description:
Initiates a new agent task execution.

This endpoint starts an agent that will perform the specified task. The agent can optionally navigate
to a provided URL before attempting to solve the task.

This agent is non-blocking and will return immediately. You should periodically check the status of the agent
until it is `closed`.

Important points:
* Remember that you can attach a `vault_id` to the agent to allow it to access credentials stored in your vault.
* Sometimes LLM providers have outages or cluster issues. Try to switch to a different reasoning model if that occurs.
* Not all models support vision. Check `litellm` documentation for more details.
* You can debug your agent execution by checking the `replay` endpoint.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/agents/start" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"task": "task",
"url": null,
"response_format": null,
"session_offset": null,
"reasoning_model": null,
"use_vision": true,
"max_steps": 20,
"vault_id": null,
"persona_id": null,
"notifier_config": null,
"session_id": "session_id"
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

get.description:
Retrieves the current status of a specific <agent_id>.

The most important fields are:
- success: Whether the agent task was successful (None if still running)
- answer: The answer to the agent task (None if still running)

Also you can check the `steps` field to better understand which actions where taken by the agent.

delete.description:
Forcefully terminates a running agent task.

> **Note:** a agent manually stopped will result in a failure for the agent to solve the task.

Furthermore, you can only stop an agent if it is still running, otherwise a 404 error will be raised.

get.description:
Retrieves the visual replay of an agent's execution session (in WebP format).

Returns:
- FileResponse: WebP format file containing the session replay
- HTTPException(404): If no replay is found for the specified agent

Retrieves a list of all agents associated with the authenticated user.

Parameters:
- request: AgentListRequest containing:
    - only_active: Whether to only return active agents
    - limit: Maximum number of agents to return

post.description:
Upload a workflow to the workflows bucket.

Args:
    file: The workflow Python file to upload
    name: Optional name for the workflow
    description: Optional description for the workflow
    shared: Whether the workflow should be shared (default: False)

If version is provided, the workflow will be stored as that version.
If version is None, a timestamp-based version will be generated.
The latest_version in the database will be updated to point to this version.

get.description:
List workflows belonging to the user.

Supports pagination and filtering by active status.

post.description:
Upload a workflow to the workflows bucket.

If version is provided, the workflow will be stored as that version.
If version is None, a timestamp-based version will be generated.
The latest_version in the database will be updated to point to this version.

schema.description: The version of the workflow to upload

get.description:
Download a workflow.

If version is provided, returns a presigned URL for that specific version.
If version is None, returns a presigned URL for the latest version.

parameters.name: decryption_key

schema.description: The decryption key for the workflow
schema.title: Decryption Key

parameters.description: The decryption key for the workflow

post.description:
Fork a shared workflow from another user.

This endpoint:
1. Validates that the source workflow exists and is shared
2. Creates a new workflow for the current user
3. Copies all versions from the source workflow's S3 storage
4. Sets the reference_workflow_id to point to the original workflow
Run a workflow with a blocking call (without run_id).

get.description: Get a specific workflow run by ID.

patch.description: Update a workflow run with new logs, result, or status.

delete.description: Stop a running workflow run and mark it as failed.

get.summary: List Workflow Runs By Workflow Id
get.description:
List workflow runs for the specified workflow.

Supports pagination and filtering by active status.

post.description:
Create a vault for storing card / credentials

This vault can only be accessed by the user & api key that created it.
Keep the vault id secret and store it safely. It will only be displayed once.

Returns:
- `vault_id`: ID of the created vault

Add credentials to the vault for a specific url

Only the root domain of the url is matching against the credentials. I.e

```python
url = "https://www.github.com/login"
```
will be used to match any request for `*.github.com/*` (subdomains are also matching).

> **Note:** credentials are encrypted and only you can access them.

Credentials include:
    - username: if no email defined
    - email: if no username defined
    - password: the password to store
    - mfa_secret: optional, the mfa secret to store

Returns:
- `status`: status of the created credentials (one of `success`, `error`)

get.description:
Get stored credentials for provided url

Only the root domain of the url is matching against the credentials. I.e

```python
url = "https://www.github.com/login"
```
will be used to match any request for `*.github.com/*` (subdomains are also matching).

> **Note:** credentials are encrypted and only you can access them.

parameters.name: url

schema.description: URL upon which to get credentials
schema.title: Url

parameters.description: URL upon which to get credentials

parameters.name: url

schema.description: URL upon which to get credentials
schema.title: Url

parameters.description: URL upon which to get credentials

get.description: List all credentials from vault

patch.description:
Update vault name

Updates the name of an existing vault. The name must be between 3 and 50 characters
and can only contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, and underscores.

Returns:
- Updated vault with new name

delete.description:
Delete provided vault

> All credentials and credit cards stored in the vault will be deleted.

post.description:
Store a credit card within the vault

All credit card details are encrypted and only you can access them.

get.description: Get stored credit card from the vault
List vaults pertaining to the user

post.description:
Create a new persona, i.e. a digital identity for your agent.
By default, a persona holds a ID (name), email address, and can be attributed a phone number and a secure vault to store credentials.

You can update the `create_vault` parameter and `create_phone_number` parameters to create a persona with a vault and a phone number.

delete.description: Delete a persona for the authenticated user.

get.description:
Retrieve a persona data by its <persona_id>.
This is usefull to retrieve the persona's email address, phone number, and vault ID after creation.

Lists emails in the persona's inbox.
Emails are sorted by date (newest first) and can be filtered by timedelta and only_unread.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of emails
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of emails

parameters.name: timedelta

schema.description: Maximum time since email reception
schema.title: Timedelta

parameters.description: Maximum time since email reception

parameters.name: only_unread

schema.description: Whether to only return unread messages
schema.title: Only Unread

parameters.description: Whether to only return unread messages

schema.title: Response Persona Emails List Personas  Persona Id  Emails Get

post.description:
Create a phone number for the persona.

This phone number is used to receive SMS messages from the web (i.e signin codes, 2FA, etc.)

Note:
- only a limited number of phone numbers are available as of now. Contact us if you need more.
- each phone number induces additional costs.

delete.description: Delete a phone number for the persona

get.description: Retrieves all active personas associated to the user's account.

get.description:
Returns a temporary URL which can be used to download a file from file storage attached to a session.

The session must have a FileStorage object attached to it when it was created (otherwise a 404 error is returned).
The file must exist in the storage (otherwise a 404 error is returned).

Note: For closed sessions use `/download` instead.

schema.title: Response File Download Storage  Session Id  Downloads  Filename  Get

get.description:
Gets a list of all the filenames in the `downloads` directory (files the agent downloaded) for a session.

The session must have a FileStorage object attached to it when it was created (otherwise a 404 error is returned).

Note: For closed sessions use `/download/list` instead.

post.description: Uploads a file to the `uploads` directory of the persistent file storage (files the agent can upload).

get.description: Gets a list of all the filenames in the `uploads` directory (files the agent can upload).

post.description:
Scrape the url provided in the request body.
Note that a session is automatically created and closed when the scrape is done.

If you need more control over the session creation (i.e proxy, etc.). You should manage the session manually
and use the `sessions/{session_id}/page/scrape` endpoint.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.notte.cc/scrape" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $NOTTE_API_KEY" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
"headless": true,
"solve_captchas": false,
"timeout_minutes": 3,
"proxies": false,
"browser_type": "chromium",
"user_agent": null,
"chrome_args": null,
"viewport_width": null,
"viewport_height": null,
"cdp_url": null,
"use_file_storage": false,
"screenshot_type": "last_action",
"scrape_links": true,
"scrape_images": false,
"ignored_tags": null,
"only_main_content": true,
"only_images": false,
"response_format": null,
"instructions": null,
"use_link_placeholders": false,
"url": "url"
}'
x-codeSamples.label: curl

post.description:
Scrape the url provided in the request body.
Note that a session is automatically created and closed when the scrape is done.

If you need more control over the session creation (i.e proxy, etc.). You should manage the session manually
and use the `sessions/{session_id}/page/scrape` endpoint.

description.description: Human-readable description of the current web page

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the created credit card

created_at.description: The creation time of the agent

saved.title: Saved
saved.description: Whether the agent is saved as a workflow

credit_usage.description: Credit usage for the agent. None if the agent is still running

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The creation time of the agent

status.description: The status of the agent (active or closed)

closed_at.title: Closed At
closed_at.description: The closing time of the agent

saved.title: Saved
saved.description: Whether the agent is saved as a workflow

credit_usage.title: Credit Usage
credit_usage.description: Credit usage for the agent. None if the agent is still running

task.title: Task
task.description: The task that the agent is currently running

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL that the agent started on

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the agent task was successful. None if the agent is still running

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: The answer to the agent task. None if the agent is still running

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: The steps that the agent has currently taken

replay_start_offset.title: Replay Start Offset
replay_start_offset.description: The start offset of the replay

replay_stop_offset.title: Replay Stop Offset
replay_stop_offset.description: The stop offset of the replay

task.title: Task
task.description: The task that the agent should perform

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL that the agent should start on (optional)

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The response format to use for the agent answer. You can use a Pydantic model or a JSON Schema dict (cf. https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/concepts/json_schema/#generating-json-schema.)

session_offset.title: Session Offset
session_offset.description: [Experimental] The step from which the agent should gather information from in the session. If none, fresh memory

use_vision.title: Use Vision
use_vision.description: Whether to use vision for the agent. Not all reasoning models support vision.

max_steps.title: Max Steps
max_steps.description: The maximum number of steps the agent should take

vault_id.title: Vault Id
vault_id.description: The vault to use for the agent

persona_id.title: Persona Id
persona_id.description: The persona to use for the agent

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: The ID of the session to run the agent on

headless.title: Headless
headless.description: Whether to run the session in headless mode.

solve_captchas.title: Solve Captchas
solve_captchas.description: Whether to try to automatically solve captchas

timeout_minutes.title: Timeout Minutes
timeout_minutes.description: Session timeout in minutes. Cannot exceed the global timeout.

proxies.title: Proxies
proxies.description: List of custom proxies to use for the session. If True, the default proxies will be used.

browser_type.title: Browser Type
browser_type.description: The browser type to use. Can be chromium, chrome or firefox.

user_agent.title: User Agent
user_agent.description: The user agent to use for the session

cdp_url.title: Cdp Url
cdp_url.description: The CDP URL of another remote session provider.

use_file_storage.title: Use File Storage
use_file_storage.description: Whether FileStorage should be attached to the session.

screenshot_type.title: Screenshot Type
screenshot_type.description: The type of screenshot to use for the session.

ApiSessionStartRequest.title: ApiSessionStartRequest
ApiSessionStartRequest.description: Request to start a new browser session.

description.title: Description
description.default: Solve a CAPTCHA challenge on the current page. CRITICAL: Use this action as soon as you notice a captcha

CaptchaSolveAction.title: CaptchaSolveAction
CaptchaSolveAction.description:
Solve a CAPTCHA challenge on the current page. CRITICAL: Use this action as soon as you notice a captcha.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import CaptchaSolveAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "captcha_solve", "captcha_type": "recaptcha"})
session.execute({"type": "captcha_solve"})  # Auto-detect captcha type
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(CaptchaSolveAction(captcha_type="recaptcha"))
session.execute(CaptchaSolveAction())
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Check a checkbox. Use `True` to check, `False` to uncheck

CheckAction-Input.title: CheckAction
CheckAction-Input.description:
Check a checkbox. Use `True` to check, `False` to uncheck.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import CheckAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "check", "id": "terms-checkbox", "value": True})
session.execute({"type": "check", "id": "newsletter-checkbox", "value": False})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(CheckAction(id="terms-checkbox", value=True))
session.execute(CheckAction(id="newsletter-checkbox", value=False))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Check a checkbox. Use `True` to check, `False` to uncheck

CheckAction-Output.title: CheckAction
CheckAction-Output.description:
Check a checkbox. Use `True` to check, `False` to uncheck.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import CheckAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "check", "id": "terms-checkbox", "value": True})
session.execute({"type": "check", "id": "newsletter-checkbox", "value": False})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(CheckAction(id="terms-checkbox", value=True))
session.execute(CheckAction(id="newsletter-checkbox", value=False))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Click on an element of the current page

ClickAction-Input.title: ClickAction
ClickAction-Input.description:
Click on an element of the current page.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ClickAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "click", "id": "submit-button"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ClickAction(id="submit-button"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Click on an element of the current page

ClickAction-Output.title: ClickAction
ClickAction-Output.description:
Click on an element of the current page.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ClickAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "click", "id": "submit-button"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ClickAction(id="submit-button"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Close the current tab

description.title: Description
description.default: Complete the task by returning the answer and terminate the browser session

CompletionAction.title: CompletionAction
CompletionAction.description:
Complete the task by returning the answer and terminate the browser session.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import CompletionAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "completion", "success": True, "answer": "Task completed successfully"})
session.execute({"type": "completion", "success": False, "answer": "Could not complete task"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(CompletionAction(success=True, answer="Task completed successfully"))
session.execute(CompletionAction(success=False, answer="Could not complete task"))
```

phone_number.title: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number that was created

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the created virtual number

CredentialsDict.title: CredentialsDict
CredentialsDict.description:
Dictionary type for storing login credentials.

At least one of email or username must be provided, but not both.
Password is required. MFA secret is optional.

Args:
    email: The email address used for login. Cannot be used with username.
    username: The username used for login. Cannot be used with email.
    password: The password for the account. Required.
    mfa_secret: Optional MFA/2FA secret key for generating one-time codes.

CreditCardDict.title: CreditCardDict
CreditCardDict.description:
Dictionary type for storing credit card information.

Args:
    card_holder_name: The name of the credit card holder as it appears on the card
    card_number: The credit card number
    card_cvv: The 3 or 4 digit CVV security code on the back of the card
    card_full_expiration: The card's expiration date in MM/YY or MM/YYYY format

markdown.title: Markdown
markdown.description: Markdown representation of the extracted data

images.title: Images
images.description: List of images extracted from the page (ID and download link)

structured.description: Structured data extracted from the page in JSON format

description.title: Description
description.default: Download files from interactive elements. Use with any clickable element which triggers a download, including button, a, div. This action can also be used to download pages which are raw files (ex. PDF viewer). CRITICAL: Use only this for file download, DO NOT use click.

DownloadFileAction-Input.title: DownloadFileAction
DownloadFileAction-Input.description:
Download files from interactive elements. Use with any clickable download file element, including button, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file download, do not use click.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import DownloadFileAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "download_file", "id": "download-button"})
session.execute({"type": "download_file", "id": "report-link"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(DownloadFileAction(id="download-button"))
session.execute(DownloadFileAction(id="report-link"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Download files from interactive elements. Use with any clickable element which triggers a download, including button, a, div. This action can also be used to download pages which are raw files (ex. PDF viewer). CRITICAL: Use only this for file download, DO NOT use click.

DownloadFileAction-Output.title: DownloadFileAction
DownloadFileAction-Output.description:
Download files from interactive elements. Use with any clickable download file element, including button, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file download, do not use click.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import DownloadFileAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "download_file", "id": "download-button"})
session.execute({"type": "download_file", "id": "report-link"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(DownloadFileAction(id="download-button"))
session.execute(DownloadFileAction(id="report-link"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Read recent emails from the mailbox.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Max number of emails to return

timedelta.title: Timedelta
timedelta.description: Return only emails that are not older than `timedelta`

EmailReadAction.title: EmailReadAction
EmailReadAction.description:
Read recent emails from the mailbox.

**Example:**
```python
import datetime as dt
from notte_core.actions import EmailReadAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "email_read", "limit": 5, "only_unread": True})
session.execute({"type": "email_read", "timedelta": "PT5M"})  # Last 5 minutes
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(EmailReadAction(limit=5, only_unread=True))
session.execute(EmailReadAction(timedelta=dt.timedelta(minutes=5)))
```

text_content.title: Text Content
text_content.description: Raw textual body, can be uncorrelated with html content

html_content.title: Html Content
html_content.description: HTML body, can be uncorrelated with raw content

ExecutionResponse.title: ExecutionResponse
ExecutionResponse.description: Used for page operation like setting cookies

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an input field with a value. Only use if explicitly asked, or you failed to input with the normal fill action

FallbackFillAction-Input.title: FallbackFillAction
FallbackFillAction-Input.description:
Fill an input field with a value. Only use if explicitly asked, or you failed to input with the normal fill action.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import FallbackFillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "fallback_fill", "id": "difficult-input", "value": "fallback text"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(FallbackFillAction(id="difficult-input", value="fallback text"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an input field with a value. Only use if explicitly asked, or you failed to input with the normal fill action

FallbackFillAction-Output.title: FallbackFillAction
FallbackFillAction-Output.description:
Fill an input field with a value. Only use if explicitly asked, or you failed to input with the normal fill action.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import FallbackFillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "fallback_fill", "id": "difficult-input", "value": "fallback text"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(FallbackFillAction(id="difficult-input", value="fallback text"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an input field with a value

FillAction-Input.title: FillAction
FillAction-Input.description:
Fill an input field with a value.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import FillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "fill", "id": "email-input", "value": "user@example.com"})
session.execute({"type": "fill", "id": "name-input", "value": "John Doe", "clear_before_fill": False})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(FillAction(id="email-input", value="user@example.com"))
session.execute(FillAction(id="name-input", value="John Doe", clear_before_fill=False))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an input field with a value

FillAction-Output.title: FillAction
FillAction-Output.description:
Fill an input field with a value.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import FillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "fill", "id": "email-input", "value": "user@example.com"})
session.execute({"type": "fill", "id": "name-input", "value": "John Doe", "clear_before_fill": False})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(FillAction(id="email-input", value="user@example.com"))
session.execute(FillAction(id="name-input", value="John Doe", clear_before_fill=False))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill a form with multiple values. Important: If you detect a form requesting personal information, try to use this action at first, and otherwise use the regular fill action. CRITICAL: If this action fails once, use the regular form fill instead.

FormFillAction.title: FormFillAction
FormFillAction.description:
Fill a form with multiple values. Critical: If you detect a form on a page, try to use this action at first, and otherwise use the regular fill action.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import FormFillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({
    "type": "form_fill",
    "value": {"email": "user@example.com", "first_name": "John", "last_name": "Doe"}
})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(FormFillAction(value={"email": "user@example.com", "first_name": "John", "last_name": "Doe"}))
```

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: The variables to run the workflow with

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The creation time of the workflow

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The last update time of the workflow

shared.title: Shared
shared.description: Whether the workflow is public and can beshared with other users

reference_workflow_id.title: Reference Workflow Id
reference_workflow_id.description: The ID of the reference workflow (i.e wether the workflow was forked from another workflow or not)

logs.title: Logs
logs.description: The logs of the workflow run

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: The variables of the workflow run

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the workflow run (if any)

local.title: Local
local.description: Whether the workflow has been run locally or on the cloud

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: The variables to run the workflow with

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The creation time of the workflow

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: The last update time of the workflow

shared.title: Shared
shared.description: Whether the workflow is public and can beshared with other users

reference_workflow_id.title: Reference Workflow Id
reference_workflow_id.description: The ID of the reference workflow (i.e wether the workflow was forked from another workflow or not)

headless.title: Headless
headless.description: Whether to run the session in headless mode.

solve_captchas.title: Solve Captchas
solve_captchas.description: Whether to try to automatically solve captchas

timeout_minutes.title: Timeout Minutes
timeout_minutes.description: Session timeout in minutes. Cannot exceed the global timeout.

proxies.title: Proxies
proxies.description: List of custom proxies to use for the session. If True, the default proxies will be used.

browser_type.title: Browser Type
browser_type.description: The browser type to use. Can be chromium, chrome or firefox.

user_agent.title: User Agent
user_agent.description: The user agent to use for the session

cdp_url.title: Cdp Url
cdp_url.description: The CDP URL of another remote session provider.

use_file_storage.title: Use File Storage
use_file_storage.description: Whether FileStorage should be attached to the session.

screenshot_type.title: Screenshot Type
screenshot_type.description: The type of screenshot to use for the session.

scrape_links.title: Scrape Links
scrape_links.description: Whether to scrape links from the page. Links are scraped by default.

scrape_images.title: Scrape Images
scrape_images.description: Whether to scrape images from the page. Images are scraped by default.

ignored_tags.title: Ignored Tags
ignored_tags.description: HTML tags to ignore from the page

only_main_content.title: Only Main Content
only_main_content.description: Whether to only scrape the main content of the page. If True, navbars, footers, etc. are excluded.

only_images.title: Only Images
only_images.description: Whether to only scrape images from the page. If True, the page content is excluded.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The response format to use for the scrape. You can use a Pydantic model or a JSON Schema dict (cf. https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/concepts/json_schema/#generating-json-schema.)

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Additional instructions to use for the scrape. E.g. 'Extract only the title, date and content of the articles.'

use_link_placeholders.title: Use Link Placeholders
use_link_placeholders.description: Whether to use link/image placeholders to reduce the number of tokens in the prompt and hallucinations. However this is an experimental feature and might not work as expected.

description.title: Description
description.default: Go back to the previous page (in current tab)

GoBackAction.title: GoBackAction
GoBackAction.description:
Go back to the previous page (in current tab).

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import GoBackAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "go_back"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(GoBackAction())
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Go forward to the next page (in current tab)

GoForwardAction.title: GoForwardAction
GoForwardAction.description:
Go forward to the next page (in current tab).

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import GoForwardAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "go_forward"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(GoForwardAction())
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Goto to a URL (in current tab)

GotoAction.title: GotoAction
GotoAction.description:
Goto to a URL (in current tab).

```python
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "goto", "url": "https://www.google.com"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(GotoAction(url="https://www.google.com"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Goto to a URL (in new tab)

GotoNewTabAction.description:

description.title: Description
description.default: Notte API is healthy and ready to serve requests. Docs available at https://docs.notte.cc

description.title: Description
description.default: Ask for clarification

HelpAction.title: HelpAction
HelpAction.description:
Ask for clarification.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import HelpAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "help", "reason": "The page layout is unclear"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(HelpAction(reason="The page layout is unclear"))
```

category.description: Category of the image (icon, svg, content, etc.)

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The creation time of the agent

status.description: The status of the agent (active or closed)

closed_at.title: Closed At
closed_at.description: The closing time of the agent

saved.title: Saved
saved.description: Whether the agent is saved as a workflow

credit_usage.title: Credit Usage
credit_usage.description: Credit usage for the agent. None if the agent is still running

task.title: Task
task.description: The task that the agent is currently running

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL that the agent started on

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the agent task was successful. None if the agent is still running

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: The answer to the agent task. None if the agent is still running

replay_start_offset.title: Replay Start Offset
replay_start_offset.description: The start offset of the replay

replay_stop_offset.title: Replay Stop Offset
replay_stop_offset.description: The stop offset of the replay

LegacyAgentStatusResponse.title: LegacyAgentStatusResponse
LegacyAgentStatusResponse.description:
This class is used to handle the legacy agent status response.
The rationale is that we are likely to change the `AgentStepResponse` in the future and we want to be able to handle the legacy response.
This is a temporary solution to avoid breaking changes.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: URLs for which we hold credentials

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an MFA input field with a value. CRITICAL: Only use it when filling in an OTP.

MultiFactorFillAction-Input.title: MultiFactorFillAction
MultiFactorFillAction-Input.description:
Fill an MFA input field with a value. CRITICAL: Only use it when filling in an OTP.

**Example:**

```python
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "multi_factor_fill", "id": "otp-input", "value": "123456"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(MultiFactorFillAction(id="otp-input", value="123456"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Fill an MFA input field with a value. CRITICAL: Only use it when filling in an OTP.

MultiFactorFillAction-Output.title: MultiFactorFillAction
MultiFactorFillAction-Output.description:
Fill an MFA input field with a value. CRITICAL: Only use it when filling in an OTP.

```python
from notte_core.actions import MultiFactorFillAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "multi_factor_fill", "id": "otp-input", "value": "123456"})

session.execute(MultiFactorFillAction(id="otp-input", value="123456"))
```

min_nb_actions.title: Min Nb Actions
min_nb_actions.description: The minimum number of actions to list before stopping. If not provided, the listing will continue until the maximum number of actions is reached.

max_nb_actions.title: Max Nb Actions
max_nb_actions.description: The maximum number of actions to list after which the listing will stop. Used when min_nb_actions is not provided.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL to observe. If not provided, uses the current page URL.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Additional instructions to use for the observation.

perception_type.title: Perception Type
perception_type.description: Whether to run with fast or deep perception

metadata.description: Metadata of the current page, i.e url, page title, snapshot timestamp.

screenshot.description: Base64 encoded screenshot of the current page

space.description: Available actions in the current state

create_vault.title: Create Vault
create_vault.description: Whether to create a vault for the persona

create_phone_number.title: Create Phone Number
create_phone_number.description: Whether to create a phone number for the persona

description.title: Description
description.default: Press a keyboard key: e.g. 'Enter', 'Backspace', 'Insert', 'Delete', etc.

PressKeyAction.title: PressKeyAction
PressKeyAction.description:
Press a keyboard key: e.g. 'Enter', 'Backspace', 'Insert', 'Delete', etc.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import PressKeyAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "press_key", "key": "Enter"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(PressKeyAction(key="Enter"))
```

ProxyGeolocation.title: ProxyGeolocation
ProxyGeolocation.description:
Geolocation settings for the proxy.
E.g. "New York, NY, US"

description.title: Description
description.default: Reload the current page

ReloadAction.title: ReloadAction
ReloadAction.description:
Reload the current page.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ReloadAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "reload"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ReloadAction())
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Scrape the current page data in text format. If `instructions` is null then the whole page will be scraped. Otherwise, only the data that matches the instructions will be scraped. Instructions should be given as natural language, e.g. 'Extract the title and the price of the product'

only_main_content.title: Only Main Content
only_main_content.description: Whether to only scrape the main content of the page. If True, navbars, footers, etc. are excluded.

ScrapeAction.title: ScrapeAction
ScrapeAction.description:
Scrape the current page data in text format. If `instructions` is null then the whole page will be scraped. Otherwise, only the data that matches the instructions will be scraped. Instructions should be given as natural language, e.g. 'Extract the title and the price of the product'.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ScrapeAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "scrape", "instructions": "Extract product title and price"})
session.execute({"type": "scrape", "only_main_content": True})
session.execute({"type": "scrape"})  # Scrape entire page
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ScrapeAction(instructions="Extract product title and price"))
session.execute(ScrapeAction(only_main_content=True))
session.execute(ScrapeAction())
```

scrape_links.title: Scrape Links
scrape_links.description: Whether to scrape links from the page. Links are scraped by default.

scrape_images.title: Scrape Images
scrape_images.description: Whether to scrape images from the page. Images are scraped by default.

ignored_tags.title: Ignored Tags
ignored_tags.description: HTML tags to ignore from the page

only_main_content.title: Only Main Content
only_main_content.description: Whether to only scrape the main content of the page. If True, navbars, footers, etc. are excluded.

only_images.title: Only Images
only_images.description: Whether to only scrape images from the page. If True, the page content is excluded.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The response format to use for the scrape. You can use a Pydantic model or a JSON Schema dict (cf. https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/concepts/json_schema/#generating-json-schema.)

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: User description as to what needs to be scraped

use_link_placeholders.title: Use Link Placeholders
use_link_placeholders.description: Whether to use link/image placeholders to reduce the number of tokens in the prompt and hallucinations. However this is an experimental feature and might not work as expected.

frames.title: Frames
frames.description: Frame data for all frames found in the page. The main frame has to be the first one

scrape_links.title: Scrape Links
scrape_links.description: Whether to scrape links from the page. Links are scraped by default.

scrape_images.title: Scrape Images
scrape_images.description: Whether to scrape images from the page. Images are scraped by default.

ignored_tags.title: Ignored Tags
ignored_tags.description: HTML tags to ignore from the page

only_main_content.title: Only Main Content
only_main_content.description: Whether to only scrape the main content of the page. If True, navbars, footers, etc. are excluded.

only_images.title: Only Images
only_images.description: Whether to only scrape images from the page. If True, the page content is excluded.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The response format to use for the scrape. You can use a Pydantic model or a JSON Schema dict (cf. https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/concepts/json_schema/#generating-json-schema.)

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Additional instructions to use for the scrape. E.g. 'Extract only the title, date and content of the articles.'

use_link_placeholders.title: Use Link Placeholders
use_link_placeholders.description: Whether to use link/image placeholders to reduce the number of tokens in the prompt and hallucinations. However this is an experimental feature and might not work as expected.

markdown.title: Markdown
markdown.description: Markdown representation of the extracted data

images.title: Images
images.description: List of images extracted from the page (ID and download link)

structured.description: Structured data extracted from the page in JSON format

model_schema.description: Output schema generated by the llm according to the instructions

scrape.description: Output from the scrape, validated upon the model schema

description.title: Description
description.default: Scroll down by a given amount of pixels. Use `null` for scrolling down one page

ScrollDownAction.title: ScrollDownAction
ScrollDownAction.description:
Scroll down by a given amount of pixels. Use `null` for scrolling down one page.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ScrollDownAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "scroll_down", "amount": 500})  # Scroll down 500 pixels
session.execute({"type": "scroll_down"})  # Scroll down one page
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ScrollDownAction(amount=500))
session.execute(ScrollDownAction(amount=None))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Scroll up by a given amount of pixels. Use `null` for scrolling up one page

ScrollUpAction.title: ScrollUpAction
ScrollUpAction.description:
Scroll up by a given amount of pixels. Use `None` for scrolling up one page.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import ScrollUpAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "scroll_up", "amount": 500})  # Scroll up 500 pixels
session.execute({"type": "scroll_up"})  # Scroll up one page
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(ScrollUpAction(amount=500))
session.execute(ScrollUpAction(amount=None))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Select an option from a dropdown. The `id` field should be set to the select element's id. Then you can either set the `value` field to the option's text or the `option_id` field to the option's `id`.

SelectDropdownOptionAction-Input.title: SelectDropdownOptionAction
SelectDropdownOptionAction-Input.description:
Select an option from a dropdown. The `id` field should be set to the select element's id. Then you can either set the `value` field to the option's text or the `option_id` field to the option's `id`.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import SelectDropdownOptionAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "select_dropdown_option", "id": "country-select", "value": "United States"})
session.execute({"type": "select_dropdown_option", "id": "size-select", "value": "Large"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(SelectDropdownOptionAction(id="country-select", value="United States"))
session.execute(SelectDropdownOptionAction(id="size-select", value="Large"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Select an option from a dropdown. The `id` field should be set to the select element's id. Then you can either set the `value` field to the option's text or the `option_id` field to the option's `id`.

SelectDropdownOptionAction-Output.title: SelectDropdownOptionAction
SelectDropdownOptionAction-Output.description:
Select an option from a dropdown. The `id` field should be set to the select element's id. Then you can either set the `value` field to the option's text or the `option_id` field to the option's `id`.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import SelectDropdownOptionAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "select_dropdown_option", "id": "country-select", "value": "United States"})
session.execute({"type": "select_dropdown_option", "id": "size-select", "value": "Large"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(SelectDropdownOptionAction(id="country-select", value="United States"))
session.execute(SelectDropdownOptionAction(id="size-select", value="Large"))
```

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Current state of the session trajectory

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: The ID of the session (created or existing). Use this ID to interact with the session for the next operation.

timeout_minutes.title: Timeout Minutes
timeout_minutes.description: Session timeout in minutes. Will timeout if now() > last access time + timeout_minutes

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if the operation failed to complete

credit_usage.title: Credit Usage
credit_usage.description: Credit usage for the session. None

proxies.title: Proxies
proxies.description: Whether proxies were used for the session. True if any proxy was applied during session creation.

use_file_storage.title: Use File Storage
use_file_storage.description: Whether FileStorage was attached to the session.

description.title: Description
description.default: Read sms messages received recently.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Max number of sms to return

timedelta.title: Timedelta
timedelta.description: Return only sms that are not older than `timedelta`

SmsReadAction.title: SmsReadAction
SmsReadAction.description:
Read sms messages received recently.

**Example:**
```python
import datetime as dt
from notte_core.actions import SmsReadAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "sms_read", "limit": 10, "only_unread": True})
session.execute({"type": "sms_read", "timedelta": "PT5M"})  # Last 5 minutes
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(SmsReadAction(limit=10, only_unread=True))
session.execute(SmsReadAction(timedelta=dt.timedelta(minutes=5)))
```

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the data was extracted successfully

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if the data was not extracted successfully

data.title: Data
data.description: Structured data extracted from the page in JSON format

description.title: Description
description.default: Switch to a tab (identified by its index)

SwitchTabAction.title: SwitchTabAction
SwitchTabAction.description:
Switch to a tab (identified by its index).

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import SwitchTabAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "switch_tab", "tab_index": 1})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(SwitchTabAction(tab_index=1))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Upload file to interactive element with file path. Use with any upload file element, including button, input, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file upload, do not use click.

UploadFileAction-Input.title: UploadFileAction
UploadFileAction-Input.description:
Upload file to interactive element with file path. Use with any upload file element, including button, input, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file upload, do not use click.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import UploadFileAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "upload_file", "id": "file-input", "file_path": "/path/to/document.pdf"})
session.execute({"type": "upload_file", "id": "image-upload", "file_path": "./image.jpg"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(UploadFileAction(id="file-input", file_path="/path/to/document.pdf"))
session.execute(UploadFileAction(id="image-upload", file_path="./image.jpg"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Upload file to interactive element with file path. Use with any upload file element, including button, input, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file upload, do not use click.

UploadFileAction-Output.title: UploadFileAction
UploadFileAction-Output.description:
Upload file to interactive element with file path. Use with any upload file element, including button, input, a, span, div. CRITICAL: Use only this for file upload, do not use click.

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import UploadFileAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "upload_file", "id": "file-input", "file_path": "/path/to/document.pdf"})
session.execute({"type": "upload_file", "id": "image-upload", "file_path": "./image.jpg"})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(UploadFileAction(id="file-input", file_path="/path/to/document.pdf"))
session.execute(UploadFileAction(id="image-upload", file_path="./image.jpg"))
```

description.title: Description
description.default: Wait for a given amount of time (in milliseconds)

time_ms.title: Time Ms
time_ms.description: The amount of time to wait in milliseconds (max 30 seconds)

WaitAction.title: WaitAction
WaitAction.description:
Wait for a given amount of time (in milliseconds).

**Example:**
```python
from notte_core.actions import WaitAction
# Dict syntax
session.execute({"type": "wait", "time_ms": 2000})
# Pydantic syntax
session.execute(WaitAction(time_ms=2000))
```
